locations.name: Bankhead
locations.description:
Apply today and join one of our co-ops to begin receiving frozen and non-perishable food, produce, and home goods. Complete the application online or call 404-590-2186 to apply today.

People can qualify for an Urban Recipe food co-op if you: 
1. are in need of food support for your household, 
2. have reliable access to a phone and transportation, 
3. have access to a stove top and storage for frozen and refrigerated items, and 
4. are willing to attend a one-time new member orientation and agree to member guidelines.

locations.name: Snellville
locations.description:
We particularly focus on helping to feed all that are in need but not limited the following groups:

The elderly living on fixed incomes
Working families considered to be low-income
Individuals with medical or physical disabilities
Homeless and transient people
Individuals and families experiencing a temporary emergency (e.g. an illness, injury, or loss of employment)
The following documentation is needed and must be presented to receive food pantry service:
Proof of Gwinnett County residence (i.e. driver license, utility bill)
Proof of U.S. citizenship (i.e. birth certificate, alien registration card, passport)
Proof of possible income documents (ie. employer pay stub, SSI benefit letter, unemployment document, retirement/pension
* Please bring a copy of the documents that will be maintained in our secure data files.

Do you need Assistance?
If you need assistance, you need to download the application and submit it and supporting documentation. Please click on the button below to download the application and submit it. https://www.purposeworldchurch.com/purposeful-food-pantry/pre-registration-application-for-certification-and-eligibility-for-food-pantry-program/
